title: Ramsden Reservoir Walk Route

images.title: Phil Catterall / Northern end of Ramsden Reservoir
images.caption: Northern end of Ramsden Reservoir

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Ramsden Reservoir, Holme
images.caption: The water level has been drawn down because of civil engineering work at the dam. Ramsden Reservoir was constructed to supply Batley.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Ramsden Reservoir, Holme
images.caption: Here the reservoir splits into two arms.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / View of an arm of Ramsden Reservoir, Cartworth
images.caption: View of an arm of Ramsden Reservoir, Cartworth. Seen from Kiln Bent Road as it goes over the dam of Riding Wood Reservoir.

images.caption: Riding Wood Reservoir - just to the south of Ramsden

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / View of an arm of Ramsden Reservoir, Cartworth
images.caption: View of an arm of Ramsden Reservoir, Cartworth. Seen from Kiln Bent Road as it goes over the dam of Riding Wood Reservoir.

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Grassy path off	Kiln Bank Road, Holme
images.caption: Grassy path off Kiln Bank Road, Holme. This was a field path in 1850, and then in the 1960s a narrow fenced path between plantations. Now it is pleasantly wide.

description: This walk visits Ramsden Reservoir near the Yorkshire town of Holmfirth. You can start the walk at the public car park at the northern end of the reservoir. From here you can pick up trails heading along the water where there are fine views of the surrounding forestry and hills. It's a very tranquil area and with easy paths, it's perfect for a peaceful Sunday afternoon stroll. Just to the north of the site you'll find Brownhill Reservoir and Digley Reservoir where there is another nice walking trail to try. You can reach it by following the waymarked Kirklees Way north for about half a mile. Follow the trail east and it will soon take you to Holme Styes Reservoir .
